show_name: Words Bubble Up Like Soda Pop (movie)
other_title: Cider no Yō ni Kotoba ga Wakiagaru (Japanese)
サイダーのように言葉が湧き上がる (Japanese)
plot: Words and music bridge the gap between Cherry, a boy who is terrible at communicating with other people, and Smile, a girl who hides behind a mask. They meet in a mundane suburban shopping mall in a provincial city. Cherry always wears headphones and puts the feelings he cannot utter into his hobby, Japanese haiku poems. Smile always wears a mask to conceal her large front teeth, for which she has dental braces. As a popular video star, she streams a video about seeking "cuteness."
